name: Hillsdale House Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived after driving from Yarmouth in blinding rain that practically forced us off the road. What a treat to be greeted so warmly, led to a delightful and spotless room (with a beautiful bathroom down a few steps, including a grand tub), referred to an excellent Austrian restaurant for dinner, and then given a marvelous breakfast the next morning. (The muffins were delicious, but it's important to save room for the "main course" that follows....) And when I had trouble with the Canadian cell phone I had purchased, Val was tremendously helpful in getting through to the provider to get it working. All in all, a terrific first night in NS! (Make sure to take time to visit the very interesting tidal power plant in Annapolis Royal, as well as the gardens.)
reviews.title: Wonderful introduction to Nova Scotia!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were pleased in every way with our stay. The breakfast was especially good and there were even deer to gaze at in the garden. A lovely atmosphere.
reviews.title: Friendly Welcome, Excellent Breakfast and Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in the early evening after about five hours of driving. The Hillsdale House is easy to locate. I had booked the room earlier based on the room photo and the offer of a discount on that room at that time. I did call to confirm. Paul welcomed us and we were shown our room. It was country chic and really comfortable. He told us about the ghost walk at Fort Anne that evening and we went. It was fantastic. Breakfast was tremendous and the entire diningroom was a lively conversation spot. I asked Val if she could ice my cooler ice blocks and that was no problem.
reviews.title: Talk about thoughtful, they provided bug repellent as you head out the door.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Elegant house. Clean charming room. Beautiful landscaping. Top notch breakfast. You will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: A special treat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the Hillsdale House Inn with our 2 year old Westie. "Stella" was greeted with her own little goody bag. The grounds were lovely and a great place for doing alot of sniffing. The resident pets were delightful and Stella especially enjoyed meeting Hannah the owners Bermese Mountain Dog. Our lovely room was located right across from a door so we had easy access to the Inn's grounds. We would highly recommend the Hillsdale House Inn to anyone traveling in the Annapolis Royal area and especially those with pets.
reviews.title: A elegant stately manor home that was very pet friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful grounds, lovely rooms, friendly staff, delicious breakfast...what more could one ask for? We had a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 3 couples stayed in B&Bs throughout Nova Scotia and PEI and this was one of our favorites! All the usual adjectives apply: charming, comfortable, friendly, delicious. Their french toast was the best!!! If you are touring around Annapolis Royal, this is the place to stay. Plus it was an unbelievably good value!
reviews.title: Beautiful house and grounds and a great breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A positive experience from beginning to end. The inn's staff did everything possible to make our stay welcoming and enjoyable. On arrival, we were offered complimentary tickets to an evening concert after expressing interest in it. The inn is well appointed with period furnishings and centrally situated for easy access to historic sites. Breakfast was delicious served promptly and efficiently by attentive staff in very comfortable surroundings.
reviews.title: Charming, well appointed inn with exceptional service and delicious breakfast
absolutely delighted
reviews.text: Our room was small but well furnished and very comfortable with a view of the gardens.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were absolutely delighted with our stay at Hillsdale House. The accommodations were first rate, the breakfast was great, the location was ideal, and the grounds were beautiful. We hope to return soon. We were there two years ago and that stay convinced it was the best place to stay in Annapolis Royal.
reviews.title: High quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful historic home walking distance from the town. Rooms beautifully appointed with period decor yet cozy and comfortable. Warm, attentive hosts and fabulous breakfast. Lovely grounds.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a small circular shower, but our friends had a room with a bathtub, so both are possible.there were stairs to climb, the room was big enough but not enormous, It was clean very comfortable and we had a nice breakfast where they produced oatmeal for us on request even though it was not on the menu. The staff were friendly and pleasant. Wi-fi in the rooms. Wine glasses on the mantel of our room; we drank the wine we bought at the local vintner's that day.
reviews.title: All the necessary elements of a good B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend Hillsdale House Inn to anyone travelling in the Annapolis Royal area. It is great value for the money. The room we had was wonderful and the breakfast was delicious - I recommend the waffles if they are on the menu.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family travelled from Baddeck through Halifax and to Annapolis Royal arriving at Hillsdale House late in the evening. The immediate welcome from our hosts and the offer of clean and comfortable rooms made for and enjoyable stay. It is often difficult to find suitable accommodation at inns or bed and breakfasts for a family of 5; however, we found our rooms better than any we had stayed at in New England on previous occasions. The breakfast was wonderful, the staff friendly, and the view of the garden picturesque -- with young deer trying to snatch fruit from the apple trees. We will definitely return!
reviews.title: A welcome respite for weary travellers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at this delightful inn. The staff were all so friendly and welcoming we felt right at home as soon as we arrived.
reviews.title: Superb place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was just as described in the website, exceptionally clean and comfortable. The breakfasts were delicious. We've never had candlelight breakfasts before!
reviews.title: HIllsdale House Was Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend the Hillside House to anyone and would love to visit again. The hospitality was second to none. Thank you all so much
reviews.title: First and definitely not the last trip to Annapolis Royal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house was just wonderful - the host's were excellent - would definately stay there again - very clean and breakfast was wonderful. Highly recommend
reviews.title: We were so pleased friends had recommended 'Hillsdale House Inn'.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was as a haven after a long rainy trip from the far northeastern part of Nova Scotia. We were greeted warmly and given good information about the inn, dining options and Annapolis Royal. This was our first visit but the surroundings were conducive to interact with other travelers, some of whom had traveled from afar as repeat guests. After a delicious breakfast, it was back in the car for our last day in Nova Scotia; but alas, more rain.
reviews.title: Pleasantly comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at Hillsdale House for one night while passing through the area. We did manage to explore most of the town of Annapolis Royal and found it a very interesting and beautiful place, with a great deal of history.
reviews.title: Beautiful and historic inn in a lovely little town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inn is absolutely lovely. We stayed in a room for three. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean and pretty, with a very nice bathroom.We had a view of the gorgeous grounds and gardens. The complementary breakfast was delicious and served in an elegant dining room with great attention to detail. The Inn is located right on the main street so is very convenient to everything, as the town is quite small. All in all a lovely experience. Thank you!
reviews.title: Very comfortable and brilliant breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay very much. The room was very nice and spacious. The garden was very relaxing and the house pets were very friendly. Highly recommended as value for money.
reviews.title: Perfect two-day stop for a group of bicyclists touring Nova Scotia.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I am a volunteer trip leader for the Bicycle Adventure Club, and this is the third time in the past seven years that my group of mostly retired Americans has stopped here. Val and Paul have dealt with our needs with great aplomb -- helping us store our bikes under cover on a rainy night, providing a room for our daily social hour, filling us up at breakfast for a day of cycling, and, of great importance to a ride leader, dealing with late additions or cancellations in our group. The Inn is immaculate, the rooms are well appointed, the breakfast is the best B&B breakfast that I have encountered in Nova Scotia, and the innkeepers are involved, nice people.
reviews.title: You are friends when you arrive and family when you leave...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This bed and breakfast is just as the reviews claim. A beautiful old home on the main highway into Annapolis Royal. In immaculate condition and arranged tastefully and beautifully. Our room we had was on the second floor a large room, in fantastic shape with no costs spared to provide the best in comfort to the guests. The bed was like sleeping on something out of heaven. While most of the other b & bs in Annapolis Royal were vacant they still were over two thirds full on a cold and wet October night. The breakfast in the morning was good but not outstanding and served by two hired workers with no sign of the hosts Val and Paul. The service during breakfast was excellent by the way. While we saw the hostess briefly in the afternoon we were unable to find the host during our entire visit despite looking and asking. Having an opportunity to meet them would have significantly enhanced the visit and given us an some more insight into the charming town. As a side note I would completely avoid Charley's the chinese restaurant in town which had very disappoting food and prefer outstanding Garrsion House or the Ye Old Pub which both had great food and good service.
reviews.title: As Good As the Reviews But Missing Hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The setting was lovely and the owners (Val and Paul) were most hospitable. We had a fabulous dinner on the waterfront not far from the Inn. The next morning, we enjoyed a delicious breakfast at the Inn with 2 other couples at our table. My husband and I will definitely stay at Hillsdale House Inn the next time we are in Annapolis Royal!
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE, GREAT PEOPLE!!
The hospitality, breakfasts, and rooms were all awesome!
reviews.text: My husband and I truly enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Hillsdale House Inn. The hospitality that Val and Paul extended to us was second to none, as were the delicious homemade morning breakfasts! We plan on returning next year for the Bike Rally, and are bringing along some friends to soak up the hospitality and charm of this very special part of Annapolis Royal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very comfortable. The king sized bed was a treat. All of the common rooms are beautifully furnished and comfortable. We enjoyed our stay!
reviews.title: Beautiful inn and a beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at this historic, well preserved inn. It is beautifully furnished with antiques, the room was very comfortable, the breakfast was tasty, and the hosts very cordial. An ideal get-away place to stay.
reviews.title: What a Great B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was my first experience with a B&B. Ruined for life I would say. A beautifully restored home with lovely grounds and verandahs. Our room was immaculate with a divinely comfortable bed. And the breakfast ....I asked for the recipe. Need I say more?
reviews.title: charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: liz Gowan
reviews.title: best B&B of our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vancouver, B.C.
reviews.title: Best stop on our east coast trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent. The Inn is well maintained and the staff were very helpful. I was an early riser but I was welcomed in the kitchen to a fresh cup of coffee before breakfast times. Breakfast was very good, great service.. Impressive grounds
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay in Annapolis Royal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely inn with exceptional service. We stayed in one of the smaller rooms on the third floor, so it was a bit snug. Wireless internet signal was weak in that part of the house, but lots of other areas in the house to sit and do what you have to do on the internet. We would definitely stay there again, even if that were the only room available.
reviews.title: Always wonderful....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful 19th century house. Lovely furniture and rugs. Many antiques. Superb breakfast. Don't fail to have the muffins or the home made bread. Friendly, very helpful hosts. Walking distance to all of scenic, historic Annapolis Royal. Large , very comfortable room. Rain shower head. We have stayed at inns and B&Bs in many countries over the last 34 years and this is by far the best. We highly recommend it and hope to come back more than once.
reviews.title: By far the best inn or b&b we've ever stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking forward to visiting again, it was really delightful.
reviews.title: Wonderful relaxing Inn & grounds with beauty, character & terrific hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived to a warm greeting from Val and lots of info about things to do and local restaurants which all turned out to be very good recommendations. Our room was spacious and very clean. Breakfasts were quite good. Location was close For walking to local attractions. If I ever get back to this area I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Friendly and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Excellent stay - very welcoming staff. Fabulous breakfast. Spacious clean room - all great!
reviews.title: Sumptuous Accommodation - great breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent, fast and staff was most helpful.
reviews.title: room good but not great, check in was hurried and had reserved room 9 and it was given to the party just ahead of us

description: Our distinctive inn is located in historic Annapolis Royal minutes from one of the oldest European settlements in the New World, Port Royal. Built as an Inn in 1859 the Hillsdale House has catered to many famous persons, including George V of England in 1884. The Inn has a long standing tradition of providing gracious accommodations set in idyllic surroundings. Our 13 guest rooms are all individually decorated with antiques and all have private en-suite baths. The property offers an estate setting on 12 acres of land with mature trees, manicured lawns, and fine gardens.
